intro: Pariana stenolemma, commonly known as the narrow-leaved pariana, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Poaceae, commonly known as the grass family. The plant is characterized by its slender, narrow leaves and compact growth habit. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
